abstract_summ: At the end of 2019 a novel virus, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), causing severe acute respiratory syndrome expanded globally from Wuhan, China.On January 9 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the identification, by Chinese Health authorities, of a novel coronavirus, further classified as SARS-CoV-2 responsible of a disease (COVID-19) ranging from asymptomatic cases to severe respiratory involvement.The World Health Organization (WHO) announced the epidemic disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 as coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).Being very contagious, the new virus led the era of “COVID-19” which is the acronym of “coronavirus disease 2019,” evoking an imminent threat to global health security with unprecedented devastating challenges to human kind.In early December 2019, an outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), occurred in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, China.
title_summ: Recommendations for COVID-19 clinical managementCoronavirus Diseases (COVID-19) Current Status and Future Perspectives: A Narrative ReviewRecent Understandings Toward Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19): From Bench to BedsideNovel coronavirus (COVID-19) infection: What a doctor on the frontline needs to knowCOVID-19: molecular diagnostics overviewCoronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19): A literature reviewThe epidemiology and clinical information about COVID-19National Institute for the Infectious Diseases “L. Spallanzani”, IRCCS.Clinical display, diagnostics and genetic implication of novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) epidemic.
title_abstract_phrases: Recommendations for COVID-19 clinical managementOn January 9 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the identification, by Chinese Health authorities, of a novel coronavirus, further classified as SARS-CoV-2 responsible of a disease (COVID-19) ranging from asymptomatic cases to severe respiratory involvement.Coronavirus Diseases (COVID-19) Current Status and Future Perspectives: A Narrative ReviewAt the end of 2019 a novel virus, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), causing severe acute respiratory syndrome expanded globally from Wuhan, China.Clinical display, diagnostics and genetic implication of novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) epidemic.Hereby, we show our recommendations for the management of COVID-19 patients, based on very limited clinical evidences; they should be considered as expert opinions, which may be modified according to newly produced literature data.Novel coronavirus (COVID-19) infection: What a doctor on the frontline needs to knowCoronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a zoonotic respiratory infection originating from Wuhan, China.
